title: 107_s1042
content: The Act titled "Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 2001" establishes the rate of payment for certain benefits for new Philippine Scouts residing in the United States. The Act redesignates provisions in title 38, United States Code, amends the rate of payment, and specifies the effective date of the amendments. The amendments made by subsection (b) will take effect on the date of enactment of this Act and apply to benefits paid for months starting on or after that date. SEC. 3 amends the rate of payment for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans. It further amends subsection (c) of section 107 of title 38, United States Code, and is effective upon enactment. SEC. 4 addresses the eligibility of certain Filipino veterans for disability pension. Section 107 of title 38, United States Code is amended to include eligibility criteria and rate of payment adjustments for benefits under chapter 15. Amendments include changes to subsections (a) and (b) regarding service qualifications and payment rates. Amendments to section 107 of title 38, United States Code establish eligibility criteria and payment rates for benefits under chapter 15. Benefits are adjusted based on residency and citizenship status, with specific rates outlined for individuals in the United States and the Republic of the Philippines. The effective date for these amendments is the enactment of the Act, applying to benefits starting from that date. SEC. 5 amends section 1734 of title 38, providing health care for Filipino veterans in the United States. SEC. 6 addresses outpatient health care for veterans in the Philippines. Sec. 1735 of title 38, United States Code, provides outpatient care and services for World War II veterans residing in the Philippines, with a limit of $500,000 in expenditures per fiscal year. Chapter 17 of title 38 is amended by adding new items after section 1734. Chapter 17 of title 38 is amended by adding new items after section 1734. Outpatient care and services for World War II veterans in the Philippines will be provided. The amendments made by this section will take effect on the enactment date of this Act.
